title: Mindray's Visionary Ultrasound Solutions Take Center Stage at WFUMB 2023 - Mindray Global
text:
"This is the ultrasound meeting to find answers, learn and network"
Occurring every 2 years, it is one of the most important events of the year for the international ultrasound, designed for multi-disciplinary professionals, both those specializing in ultrasound and those with a more general clinical interest who want to be updated on developments in the field.
Prof. Sudhir Vinayak
WFUMB Current President
In a resounding display of innovation and commitment to advancing healthcare, Mindray has emerged as a trailblazer at the World Federation for Ultrasound in Medicine and Biology (WFUMB) 2023. This prestigious event witnessed the introduction of Mindray's visionary ultrasound technologies for liver and superficial organs assessment and the grand launch of the Resona I series. These pioneering developments aim to revolutionize the landscape of medical diagnostics and enhance patient care.
Project 2025: Advancing healthcare through education, collaboration, and innovation Mindray's "Project 2025" aligns with the committeeâ€™s vision, focusing on education, basic ultrasound training, clinical diagnostics, and academic exchange programs. Emphasizing the importance of working with clinicians through multi-center studies and research programs, Mindray is dedicated to the mission of "better healthcare for all" and provides the MindTalk platform for global ultrasound experts to exchange and collaborate.
The MindTalk academic sharing event in Muscat, Oman on November 4th marked an impressive beginning to WFUMB2023.
China has made significant strides in the field of ultrasound applications, showcasing remarkable progress in the manufacturing industry and clinical advancements. Dedicated efforts from Chinese doctors and engineers have played a crucial role in this achievement. This collaboration between China and the world looks incredibly promising.
Prof. Liang Ping
Chairman, Ultrasonic Committee of Chinese Medical Association
This strengthening of ultrasound cooperation and exchanges with China and the world is significant. By fostering collaborative partnerships, we can maximize the potential of this incredible technology and collectively drive advancements that will benefit patients worldwide.
Prof. Maija Radzina
Chief of RSU Radiology Research Laboratory
President of Latvian Radiology Association
EUROSON 2023 President
Mindray's Project 2025 aims to enhance healthcare through education and training, foster clinical diagnostics and academic exchange, and promote collaborative multi-center studies. Our vision is to make technology more accessible, ensuring better healthcare for all.
Mr. Gene Liang
Director of Global Marketing, Mindray Medical Imaging
Superior liver and superficial organs assessment Participants were engrossed with the symposium and workshop - Prof. Richard Barr introduced New Innovative Tools to Assess Liver Diseases, Prof. Vito Cantisani elaborated on how Mindray Unveils a New Era in Ultrasound for Superficial Organs Assessment, while Prof. Popescu highlighted Mindray's liver package.
With enhanced ultrasound capabilities, healthcare professionals can now take advantage of precise liver evaluations, improving patient outcomes.
New Resona I Series grand release in the spotlight The newly unveiled solutions at WFUMB 2023, represent a monumental leap forward in ultrasound technology. A host of remarkable improvements, expanding the horizons of clinical applications reinforced Mindray's collaboration with its valued customers.
This new series boasts a sleek and intuitive design and enhanced performance capabilities. Healthcare providers can expect a superior diagnostic experience, thanks to the Resona I series, equipped with state-of-the-art innovations. The result is more accurate and efficient diagnoses, translating to elevated standards of patient care.
Deepening customer engagement At the heart of Mindray's success lies its unwavering dedication to customer satisfaction, a commitment that has taken center stage at WFUMB 2023. The company's proactive approach to understanding the unique needs and challenges of healthcare professionals has not only led to the creation of world-class ultrasound solutions but also fortified Mindray's reputation as a true partner in healthcare.
Mindray's groundbreaking innovations in liver and superficial organs assessment, together with the Resona I ultrasound series, affirm the company's position as a pioneer in medical technology. With the commitment to enhancing healthcare, expanding clinical applications, and engaging more deeply with customers, Mindray is propelling the field of medical diagnostics into a brighter and healthier future for patients and healthcare providers worldwide.
